SEARCH
Package gw.api.util.phone

Interface GWPhoneNumber

All Known Implementing Classes:
GWPhoneNumberImpl, GWPhoneNumberUnknown
public interface GWPhoneNumber
This interface is designed to represent a phone number.
See Also:
  • PhoneFields

  • Method Details

    • getCountryCode

      PhoneCountryCode getCountryCode()
      Returns:
      Returns the PhoneCountryCode of the phone number.

    • setCountryCode

      GWPhoneNumber setCountryCode(PhoneCountryCode code)
      Sets the phone country code. Implementing classes should make sure GWPhoneNumber is an immutable object. Calling this method should return a new object.
      Parameters:
      code - PhoneCountryCode
      Returns:
      A new GWPhoneNumber object

    • getNationalNumber

      String getNationalNumber()
      Returns:
      The national subscriber number portion of the phone number. This method will return an unformatted string of numbers.

    • getNationalNumberFormatted

      String getNationalNumberFormatted()
      Returns:
      The national subscriber number portion of the phone number. This method will return a domestically formatted string.

    • getExtension

      String getExtension()
      Returns:
      Then extension portion of a phone number.

    • isNANPANumber

      boolean isNANPANumber()
      Returns:
      true if the phone number is part of the North American Numbering Plan Association, also known as, region 1.

    • format

      String format(PhoneCountryCode viewingCountry)
      This returns a formatted phone number based on the perspective of the viewing country.
      If the phone number country code is the same as the viewing country, then the number will be formatted as a domestic number. Otherwise, it'll be formatted as an international number.
      For Example:
      For a US number of 6505551212, it will be formatted as 650-555-1212 when viewingCountry is the US. Otherwise this method will return +1-650-555-1212
      Parameters:
      viewingCountry - This is the country in which you are viewing the phone number.
      Returns:
      A formatted phone number

    • formatWithLocalizedExtension

      String formatWithLocalizedExtension(PhoneCountryCode viewingCountry)
      This is mainly the same as format(typekey.PhoneCountryCode) but will format the string with a configurable extension pattern. The extension can be configured via the display key: Java.PhoneUtil.FormatPattern.Extension.
      Parameters:
      viewingCountry -
      Returns:
      A formatted phone number

    • formatIntlWithLocalizedExtension

      String formatIntlWithLocalizedExtension()
      This is mainly the same as format(typekey.PhoneCountryCode) but will always use the international format
      Returns:
      A formatted phone number

    • isValid

      boolean isValid()
      This is a very strict validity check. The default implementation is based off of the nationalNumberPattern node in PhoneNumberMetaData.xml.
      Returns:
      true if the phone number is valid.

    • isPossible

      boolean isPossible()
      This is loose validity check. The default implementation is based off of the possibleNumberPattern node in PhoneNumberMetaData.xml.
      Returns:
      true if this is a possible phone number.

    • equals

      boolean equals(Object other)
      This method will only return true if the phone numbers are an exact match. This is method is only in the interface to call attention to isMatch(GWPhoneNumber) as an alternative that provides a bit more flexibility.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The other GWPhoneNumber object
      Returns:
      true if the phone number is an exact match.
      See Also:
      • isMatch(GWPhoneNumber)

    • isMatch

      GWPhoneMatchType isMatch(GWPhoneNumber other)
      This method will only return true if the phone numbers are an exact match.
      Parameters:
      other - The other GWPhoneNumber object
      Returns:
      A GWPhoneMatchType. See link for more details

    • areaCode

      String areaCode()
      This method is only guaranteed to work with region 1 phone numbers. The concept of an area-code is ill-defined elsewhere and should be used sparingly.
      Returns:
      The area code

    • getRawInput

      String getRawInput()
      Returns:
      The raw input string used to create the GWPhoneNumber object.
